item.title: Triple-i Initiative Showcase 2025—Everything Announced
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/triple-i-initiative-showcase-2025-everything-announced/

One year after the debut showcase, the Triple-i Initiative is back with its showcase event for 2025. Featuring 35+ games over 45 minutes, this year’s showcase is bringing fans a look at some of the most anticipated games of the year.

In addition to getting a look at new games, there will also be updates on a number of games either already confirmed to be in development or getting updates in the near future.

Some of the game’s confirmed to appear during the showcase include Enshrouded, Heroes of Might & Magic Olden Era, Shapez 2, BlazBlue Entropy Effect, Deep Rock Galactic: Rogue Core, Morbid Metal, Vampire Survivors, and more. Studios involved in the 2025 Triple-i Initiative Showcase include Ghost Ship Games, Pixelated Milk, Askiisoft, 11bit, Keen Games, and dozens of others.

The show begins at Noon ET/9am PT on Thursday and will be updated throughout. That means all of the announcements below are listed in the order they appeared. You can also watch the show, in its entirety, below.

Before and during the show, make sure you let us know down below what game(s) you are most excited about. And join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming forums.

item.title: Marathon Will Not Require A PSN Account on Other Platforms
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/marathon-will-not-require-a-psn-account-on-other-platforms/

Marathon developers have confirmed that players will not need a PSN account to play the game on PC and Xbox.

Marathon Doesn’t Require PSN on Xbox and PC

With Marathon being a Sony-backed project, many players worried they might need a PSN account to play the game on other platforms. However, as Eurogamer spotted, Bungie has removed these worries through a message on the game’s official Discord channel. The developers have explicitly stated, “Marathon will not require a PlayStation Account for players on PC and Xbox.”

Several of PlayStation’s initial releases on PC came with a PSN account requirement. Many might remember the whole review-bombing fiasco with Helldivers 2 when it was released on Steam in early 2024. Since then, PlayStation has learned that players on other platforms do not wish to use a PSN account and have made the sign-up optional and also tried to incentivise it for their recent releases like The Last of Us 2 Remastered, God of War Ragnarök and more. And now, with the latest confirmation, Marathon can be added to the list of games that don’t require a PSN account.

Marathon has been under wraps since its initial reveal, but players will finally learn more about the game on April 12. Bungie has announced a gameplay reveal showcase for their upcoming PvP extraction shooter. In 2023, Insider Gaming exclusively revealed how the loot system works in the game.

What do you think about Marathon not requiring a PSN account on other platforms? Let us know in the comments or on our community forum!
